docs.snippet: PUERTO PLATA, Dominican-Republic--The Latin American and Caribbean nations--out of the sight and minds of most foreigners-- have been singularly successful in projecting an image of regional solidarity to the rest of the world for years.
docs.lead_paragraph: PUERTO PLATA, Dominican-Republic--The Latin American and Caribbean nations--out of the sight and minds of most foreigners-- have been singularly successful in projecting an image of regional solidarity to the rest of the world for years.
docs.abstract: Article on failure of recent talks by sugar producing nations, who sought to achieve uniformity on raw materials export prices by regulating prices of sugar; finds talks failed as result of 'chasms' that divide sugar producing nations and because sugar importers can produce beets or cane or can use substitutes; intricacies of world sugar pricing system discussed (L)

docs.snippet: PARIS Last May's referendum on divorce, Italian style, reached heights of passion topped by the absurd. In Sicily, Amintore Fanfani, a former Premier who dominates the powerful Christian Democratic party, warned darkly that unless the divorce...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS Last May's referendum on divorce, Italian style, reached heights of passion topped by the absurd. In Sicily, Amintore Fanfani, a former Premier who dominates the powerful Christian Democratic party, warned darkly that unless the divorce legislation were repealed, Italian wives would desert their men en masse to flee with lesbians.
docs.abstract: Nan Robertson survey article on divorce situation in various countries around the world (L)

headline.main: Divorce Around the World: Even When Easy, It Carries a Stigma

byline.original: By NAN ROBERTSON Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PARIS Overnight, by resolute and skillful leadership in the Mayaguez crisis, President Ford has seemingly moved from the doldrums of Hooverdom toward the vigor of Harry Truman. He made up his mind; he consulted political leaders; he acted; and he...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS Overnight, by resolute and skillful leadership in the Mayaguez crisis, President Ford has seemingly moved from the doldrums of Hooverdom toward the vigor of Harry Truman. He made up his mind; he consulted political leaders; he acted; and he succeeded. Small as the incident may later seem in history, a polluting stain is being erased from the previous American image of lassitude, uncertainty and pessimism.
docs.abstract: C L Sulzberger article lauding Pres Ford's 'resolute and skillful' leadership in US mil rescue of containership Mayaguez from Cambodian capture as indication of new vibrancy in Western democracies; discusses gen pol malaise in such key countries as US, GB and Italy and importance of type of leadership exhibited by Ford in this incident

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 17--The Organization of American States today elected Alejandro Orfila of Argentina as its Secretary General.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 17--The Organization of American States today elected Alejandro Orfila of Argentina as its Secretary General.
docs.abstract: UPl repts that OAS made key decision on May 17 that virtually assures trade embargo against Cuba will be lifted in '75; Gen Assembly vote to end '64 ban as soon as Rio treaty under which sanctions were imposed can be reformed at conf in July (S)

headline.main: ARGENTINE AIDE ELECTED BY O.A.S.; Envoy Is Chosen Secretary General After Deadlock

docs.snippet: MORGES, Switzerland Flowers are not the sort of contraband your traditional smuggler would be seen dead with, unless they are the ones that are injected, swallowed or smoked. But nowadays, the international traffic in plants the kind you simply look...
docs.lead_paragraph: MORGES, Switzerland Flowers are not the sort of contraband your traditional smuggler would be seen dead with, unless they are the ones that are injected, swallowed or smoked. But nowadays, the international traffic in plants the kind you simply look at or, if you must bore them, talk to is so intense that it threatens the survival of some of the world's most beautiful and interesting species.
docs.abstract: article on upcoming Conv on Internatl Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora, Morges, Switzerland, that is aimed at saving some plants from extinction; notes internatl traffic in plants is intense to degree that it threatens survival of some species; illus (L)
